editorialNotes.standard: Pro photographers have sworn by Photoshop for decades, and this streamlined image-editing toolkit puts its legendary power in anyone’s hands. From instant fix-ups to fine-tuned adjustments, everything you need is here and easy to use—plus lots of fun filters and frames. Best of all, Photoshop Express can sync with other apps in the Adobe family for even more ways to make your snapshots look their best.
editorialNotes.short: From instant fix-ups to fine-tuned adjustments, everything you need is here.

editorialNotes.standard: Social media looks so much better with Adobe Premiere Rush. One of our favourite features is one-click auto-duck audio mixing, which does not add quacking noises but rather automatically adjusts the volume of background music during voiceovers.

editorialNotes.standard: This isn’t just a set of perfectly made film-emulation presets and editing tools. It’s also a community of millions of creators sharing and discovering their work – and encouraging you to snap your own.
editorialNotes.short: Take film-like photos with continuously updated filters.

editorialNotes.standard: Plenty of photo-editing apps come with filters, but Polarr can help you create your own. And you don’t need the eye of a professional photographer, either. Thanks to instinctive touch controls and a ton of built-in filters to use as jumping-off points, it’s simple to tweak your images to get the perfect balance of colour and light. For the shutterbug pros, Polarr goes deep and allows fine adjustments to saturation, lens distortion and a whole lot of other settings that we dabblers just pretend to understand.
editorialNotes.short: Advanced auto-enhance tools and filters to edit every detail of your photo.
